poem:
### Courtroom Morning

In the gray of morning,  
a name echoes—Tyler.  
Cold air clings  
to whispers of reprisal  
and the silent shards  
of a gavel's descent.  
Utah sun warms the stones  
outside the courthouse—  
a brief blaze  
before shadows reclaim  
their place on the walls.  
Words will mark  
the weight of intent,  
law spoken in fragmented light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Charlie Kirk shooting suspect expected to appear in Utah court Tyler Robinson, the 22-year-old suspect in the killing of rightwing provocateur Charlie Kirk last week, is expected to appear in a Utah court later today to face formal charges that could include one of capital murder. Robinson was arrested after a frantic, manhunt and now formal charging documents are set to be made public after a later morning news conference by the Utah county prosecutor,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
